items.description: Rivers in the Forest of Dean
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels are falling, the risk of flooding from localised heavy rainfall has now reduced.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid contact with flood water.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the River Exe has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen whilst showery rain continues over the next 3 days.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Cole and Dorcan Brook as a result of heavy rainfall overnight. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland has occurred overnight and is expected to continue this morning 28/06/2021, especially in the Lower Stratton area. River levels on the Dorcan Brook also responded to the rainfall but are still within banks. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.
Further thunderstorms and outbreaks of rain are forecast this afternoon, overnight and tomorrow. River levels have peaked and started falling, but still pose a flood risk.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 28/06/2021, or as the situation changes.

We will be monitoring the situation throughout the day and will issue updates as required.

This Flood Alert has been removed.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond will be 4.61mAOD at 18:15 on 28/06/21 and 4.73mAOD at 07:00 on 29/06/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is normal for this time of year at 70 cubic metres per second and is rising. We anticipate the flows to remain normal for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 11:00 on 29/06/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Kennet as a result of heavy rainfall overnight. Therefore, the risk of flooding remains, especially in the Knighton area. 
Further thunderstorms and outbreaks of rain are forecast this afternoon, overnight and tomorrow. We expect river levels to remain high for the next few days.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels and remain safe and aware of your local surroundings. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 29/06/2021, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels have risen on the upper River Loddon as a result of heavy rainfall yesterday afternoon and overnight. Therefore, flooding of low lying roads and farmland is expected this morning, 28/06/21, especially in the Bramley and Sherfield on Loddon Areas. 

Further heavy rainfall showers are possible today and tomorrow. We expect river levels to remain high and sensitive to further forecast rainfall. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels, avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 29/06/21, or earlier if the situation changes

This message has been issued because some minor flooding to low lying land, roads and riverside areas is likely for the rest of today, Monday 28th June.    We are not currently expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. The forecast is for some isolated showers through this evening and overnight, some of which could be heavy. River levels remain higher than normal following this morning's rain. Take care on riverside footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation, and not expecting the situation to escalate.  We will update this message by 10am tomorrow, Tuesday 29th June.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels are falling, the risk of flooding from localised heavy rainfall has now reduced.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid contact with flood water.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Stour, River Lodden, River Shreen

items.message:
The forecasted flood alert did not trigger overnight as lower rainfall totals were recorded. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area.
The forecast is for further, at times heavy, rainfall for today and tomorrow.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.
